result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward E Flournoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $825.00 payable to Beverly A.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with 395 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain employment, job training, education or combination of all.

- No driving without a valid driver's license, ownership, insurance or in the vehicle as a passenger of non-licensed person (individual). 
- No contact with: Any businesses and people with whom were affected.  No contact with geographical location as placed on the record.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
- Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 03/09/2017 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 16CF724 (22 Pages).

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Sentencing continued.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Beverly A.

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS with 395 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment, job training, education or combination of all.
- No driving without a valid driver's license, ownership, insurance or in the vehicle as a passenger of non-licensed person (individual). 
- No contact with: Any businesses and people with whom were affected.  No contact with geographical location as placed on the record.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $825.00 payable to Beverly A.  
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Edward E Flournoy in custody.  Philip Thomas Kovoor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Proceeded.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Edward E Flournoy not in court, in custody and not produced.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for sentencing hearing on February 7, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. State needs additional time to comply with victim notification. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37, February 7, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. sentencing date is vacated.   All parties are advised effective February 6, 2017 case will be in Room 512 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Edward E Flournoy in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

For reasons stated on the record, jury trial on February 6, 2017 at 9:00 a.m. is vacated. Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37. All parties are advised effective February 6, 2017 case will be in Room 512 of the Courthouse. COURT RETAINED COURT FILE. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for final pretrial, however Branch 37 is in jury trial for today's proceedings, case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 37 on February 2, 2017 at 1:30 pm.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Edward E Flournoy in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for final pre-trial. For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS Defense request to reschedule final pre-trial date. Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 37. Court trial calendared for February 6, 2017 at 9:00 a.m.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Edward E Flournoy in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Edward E Flournoy in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court on state's motion for joinder of cases 16CF724, 16CF421, 15CF2391, and 16CF2429.  Arguments heard.  Court ordered this case joined with 16CF724 for trial.  Case remains calendared for final pre-trial 1/17/17 and jury trial 2/6/17 in branch 37.
